semantic_identifier: 14: fix: Make semantic clustering deterministic and idempotent on re-ingest (prevent duplicate themes)

sections.text:
## Description

This PR fixes non-deterministic semantic clustering that could create duplicate clusters/themes when the same conversations are re-ingested.

Changes:
- Stabilized clustering inputs by introducing a canonical text normalization step (whitespace/punctuation/locale casing handling) and ensuring the embedding model identifier/version is part of the clustering key/metadata.
- Added deterministic clustering behavior by explicitly sorting inputs and using stable tie-breaking when distances/similarities are equal.
- Implemented idempotent upsert logic for clusters/themes:
  - Derives a stable cluster fingerprint from (embedding version + normalized representative text + clustering config).
  - Reuses an existing cluster when the fingerprint matches; otherwise creates a new one.
  - Updates cluster membership via merge/upsert semantics instead of insert-only, preventing re-ingest from forking themes.
- Added a regression test that ingests the same set of source conversations twice and asserts:
  - identical cluster IDs across runs,
  - identical membership sets per cluster,
  - no additional clusters created on the second run.

Notes:
- No user-facing API changes; the primary impact is more consistent clustering results and elimination of duplicate themes after reprocessing.

## How Has This Been Tested?
